Name: Acquisition
Description: An acquisition takes place when one company completely buys out another company, and the former company remains.  Examples include:  - investment firm buys all the stock of a public company (Blackstone Group buys Harrah's Entertainment)  - company buys another company (Wachovia buys First Union) If the two companies join together to become a new company, it is then considered a merger (Arcelor and Mittal Steel merge and become ArcelorMittal).

Properties.Name: Divisions formed
Properties.Description: If the acquired company became a division of the acquirer, enter that division here. (If it became a subsidiary company, enter it under the property "subsidiary companies" instead.)
